intro: Senecio glaberrimus, commonly known as the nakedstem senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. It has a woody stem that is smooth and hairless, giving it its common name. Senecio glaberrimus produces small yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators.
